1.description: Audit remote access tools on your network to identify currently used and/or authorized software.

2.command: Review logs for remote access software
2.description: Review logs for execution of remote access software to detect abnormal use of programs running as a portable executable.

3.command: Use security software for remote access detection
3.description: Use security software to detect instances of remote access software being loaded only in memory.

4.description: Require authorized remote access solutions to be used only from within your network over approved remote access solutions, such as VPNs or VDIs.

5.description: Block both inbound and outbound connections on common remote access software ports and protocols at the network perimeter.

6.description: Implement FIDO/WebAuthn authentication or PKI-based MFA to resist phishing and prevent push bombing or SIM swap attacks.

7.description: Strictly limit the use of Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) and other remote desktop services.

8.description: Audit the network for systems using RDP.

10.description: Enforce account lockouts after a specified number of attempts.

12.description: Implement a recovery plan to maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location.

13.description: Maintain offline backups of data and regularly maintain backup and restoration (daily or weekly at minimum).

14.description: Require all accounts with password logins to comply with NIST's standards for developing and managing password policies.

15.description: Require phishing-resistant multifactor authentication (MFA) for all services to the extent possible.

16.description: Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date. Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities in internet-facing systems.

17.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware.

18.description: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity and potential traversal of the indicated ransomware with a networking monitoring tool.

19.description: Install, regularly update, and enable real-time detection for antivirus software on all hosts.

21.command: Add email banner for external emails
21.description: Consider adding an email banner to emails received from outside your organization.

23.description: Ensure all backup data is encrypted, immutable, and covers the entire organizationâ€™s data infrastructure.
